backend/main.mo: Motoko canister managing user profiles with auth checks and contact inquiry submission and admin retrieval sorted by time.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report listing features, associated files, components, tests, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries describing the purpose of various frontend components, styles, hooks, and pages.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base layer defining CSS variables for light/dark themes and applying global background and text styles.
frontend/index.html: Basic HTML entry page mounting the app root and loading the main TypeScript module.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main app component toggling between marketing and admin views with theme support and slug validation.
frontend/src/components/Admin/AdminInqui: Admin page listing contact inquiries with detail dialogs, loading states, and a back-to-site action.
frontend/src/components/Admin/AdminRoute: Route guard enforcing Internet Identity authentication and admin role before rendering children.
frontend/src/components/Auth/LoginButton: Login/logout button integrating Internet Identity with loading states and query cache clearing.
frontend/src/components/Auth/ProfileSetu: Displays a dialog for entering and submitting a user's name using a profile‑save mutation.
frontend/src/components/Contact/ContactF: Handles contact form input, submission, success messaging, and error display using a contact inquiry mutation.
frontend/src/components/Layout/SiteFoote: Renders the site footer with branding, copyright, and a referral link.
frontend/src/components/Layout/SiteLayou: Wraps pages with a header, footer, and main content area, supporting view switching.
frontend/src/components/MarketingSite/Ma: Composes marketing sections and conditionally shows the profile setup dialog based on authentication and profile state.
frontend/src/components/MarketingSite/se: Presents company background, mission, expertise, and approach with branding content.
Displays a grid of government‑focused capabilities with icons and bullet lists.
Shows the contact form and company contact details including email, phone, and location.
Renders the hero section with branding, messaging, call‑to‑action buttons, and a hero image.
Renders a marketing services grid displaying predefined service items with icons, titles, and descriptions.
frontend/src/components/Navigation/SiteH: Provides the site header with navigation, authentication-aware actions, and mobile menu behavior.
frontend/src/config/branding.ts: Defines centralized company branding settings including name, tagline, domain, and generated deployment slug.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor tied to the user’s identity with automatic query invalidation on change.
frontend/src/hooks/useAdminInquiries.ts: Exposes queries for fetching all contact inquiries or a single inquiry through the actor API.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Implements an Internet Identity provider and hook for authentication state, login, logout, and identity restoration.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Provides hooks for fetching and updating user profiles and roles through the actor with react-query.
frontend/src/hooks/useSubmitContactInqui: Defines a mutation for submitting contact inquiries via the backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Configures global Tailwind CSS styles, color variables, and typography for the application.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/utils/slug.ts: Contains utilities for creating and validating sanitized domain-friendly slugs.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Provides helpers to read URL parameters (including hash routing), store/retrieve them in sessionStorage, and clear parameters from session or hash.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining theme extensions, custom colors, animations, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animation.
project_state.json: Project metadata describing the marketing site’s purpose, requirements, known deployment issues, features, and image needs.
